location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 139: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil CB, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell refers to Justin Sheil's letter of 15 March 1850, which concerned the Agent at Shiraz, Meerza Mahmood. Hennell promises to establish the truth or falsehood of the complaints made against the Agent and also to fine the Agent twelve tomans for his disobedience and disrespect.
